text: Almer is in constant pain two weeks ago
he hit a landmine since then he barely
speaks it hurts so much he tells me his
family went to check on the home they
fled Omar was injured but his mother and
six brothers were instantly killed his
father still remembers how he received
the news my mind stopped working I
couldn't feel my body I could probably
eat or sleep I wanted to die that very
moment hospitals are overwhelmed with
serious casualties doctors struggle to
keep them alive in this hospital only me
I treat over hundreds of cases every day
I am though more than 15 operation we
need help now I am talking with all the
patient we lost our instrument we
suffering of lack of facilities and
medical section the fighting has moved
on from the city but the scars remain
streets are empty water and basic
services are scarce in some districts a
silent threat looms these scenes of
devastation are repeated all over Aden
just have a look at this building behind
me it's one example of the heavy
fighting and shelling that took place in
this city and given the scale of the
damage there's actually little chance
that the people who used to live here
we returned home anytime soon scattered
across the city many take shelter in
schools and mosques they survive on
limited aid and fear for their
children's future these families have
been here for nearly six months they say
life has been hard on them
the single mom goes out begging to feed
her five boys I'm miserable and in pain
there is no one supporting me on my
family I carry a heavy burden and I'm
alone the people of Aden have nowhere to
go
we can only wait and hope they are
caught in the middle of a complex war
and they don't know who to blame
